intro: Dalbergia stenophylla, commonly known as the African rosewood, is a tropical tree native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood, which is highly valued for its aesthetic and structural properties. The plant has bipinnate leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are followed by elongated pods. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is also cultivated in horticultural settings.
